docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 12 -- The Pan - American Ophthalmology Association today termed the treatment of glaucoma an outstanding success in its efforts to prevent blindness. The association ended its fourth congress, which was attended by 1,200 delegates...
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 12 -- The Pan - American Ophthalmology Association today termed the treatment of glaucoma an outstanding success in its efforts to prevent blindness. The association ended its fourth congress, which was attended by 1,200 delegates from twenty-two nations. Its next congress will be held in Sanitago, Chile, in January, 1956.
docs.abstract: Dr A Vazquez Barriere hon; widow of Dr H S Gradle named blindness-prevention activities exec dir

headline.main: GLAUCOMA FIGHT TERMED SUCCESS; Progress in Halting Disease Causing Blindness Described by Ophthalmology Congress

docs.snippet: PARIS, Jan. 16 -- Ernest A. Gross, United States representative, said today that the power of world opinion was responsible for the Soviet Union's decision to come forward "with atomic control proposals it denominates as 'new.'"

docs.snippet: PARIS, Jan. 17 -- The Political and Security Committee of the United Nations General Assembly refused today to vote on the new Soviet atomic proposals or any others submitted by the Soviet Union regarding the question of disarmament, and instead...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Jan. 17 -- The Political and Security Committee of the United Nations General Assembly refused today to vote on the new Soviet atomic proposals or any others submitted by the Soviet Union regarding the question of disarmament, and instead referred them to the United Nations Disarmament Commission.
docs.abstract: USSR proposal rejected by UN Assembly com

headline.main: SOVIET ATOM PLAN DEFERRED BY U. N.; Vishinsky Proposal Is Shifted to Disarmament Unit for Debate Starting Feb. 10

docs.snippet: LONDON, Jan. 18 -- Starting a week from tomorrow, the ration of fresh beef, mutton or pork will be reduced by nearly 20 per cent, but the bacon ration will be increased from three to four ounces a week.

docs.snippet: PARIS, Jan. 19 -- The United Nations General Assembly declared formally today that South-West Africa -- German territory before the first world war -- should be placed under the trusteeship system of the world organization.

docs.snippet: PARIS, Jan. 23 -- The United States and eleven other sponsors presented a resolution to the General Assembly today hailing the emergence of Libya as an independent state and urging her admission to the United Nations.
